newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: ChinaBank to ease entry of foreigners.
newsitem.headline: ChinaBank to ease entry of foreigners.

text.p: China Banking Corp (ChinaBank) said on Friday its board of directors had agreed to ease the entry of foreign investors into the bank.
In the past, foreign investors had to secure the board's approval before acquiring ChinaBank shares.
Vice president Arsenio Lim told the Philippine Stock Exchange that the bank's charter will be amended and acquisition by foreigners of the bank shares would be subject to governing regulations.
Under Philippine law, foreigners can own up to a maximum of 30 percent with prior approval by the Monetary Board, and 40 percent, with prior approval of the President.
